intro: Rubus zanthoxylon, commonly known as the yellow-stemmed blackberry, is a species of bramble native to certain regions of Asia. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are usually dark purple to black in color when mature. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges or disturbed soils. Botanically, it belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is closely related to other bramble species.
